newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Tractebel first-half 1996 earnings rise.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Tractebel first-half 1996 earnings rise.

text.p: Belgian utility group Tractebel said on Monday net first-half 1996 earnings per share rose 9.2 percent, thanks to better performances in electricity production, communications and real estate.
Tractebel group net profit rose to 7.51 billion francs ($240.5 million) from 6.81 billion. Consolidated earnings per share rose to 539.6 francs from 494.3.
The group said its exceptional earnings included a 975 million franc gain from the flotation of its U.S. unit Sipex.
It also said that consolidated full-year 1996 earnings should be higher than in 1995. ($1=31.22 Belgian Franc)
